page.title: 01WEST OF KIRKCUDBRIGHT
page.content: Twisting, narrow roads connect one small farm to another. The type of farm depends on the quality of the land around it: hay, crops, sheep, cattle or a combination. Mid-way along the coastal road is the Gibbhill sawmill where trees from nearby coniferous plantations are stripped and sawn. Further on is Seaward Caravan Park, a popular resort with the area's many Summer visitors. On the Kirkcudbright side of the Dee is a boat-building yard, adjacent to the Yatching Club H.Q. Along the mud-flats of the estuary are moored many small boats. At the historic site of the Castledykes are the schools, the football pitch and a recent housing scheme. Building has also begun of a sewage reprocessing plant. Beyond the town lies St. Mary's Isle, a beautiful, wooded private estate.
